title: FAQ on the Syrian Civil War |url=https://www.crf-usa.org/images/pdf/syriafaqs.pdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221222175528/https://www.crf-usa.org/images/pdf/syriafaqs.pdf |archive-date=22 December 2022 |website=Constitutional Rights Foundation |page=6}}</ref>

sentences.text: Hamas have a history of violently suppressing Islamist anti-Hamas groups in the Gaza Strip|Islamic extremists in the Gaza Strip. They have particularly clashed with supporters of Al-Qaeda and ISIS, and groups who conducted attacks against Palestinian Christians or Islamism in the Gaza Strip|other targets in the Gaza Strip. In 2009 in the Palestinian territories|2009, Hamas security forces Battle of Rafah (2009)|eliminated a small group of Al-Qaeda sympathisers who established the Islamic Emirate of Rafah.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web | url=https://ctc.westpoint.edu/salafi-jihadi-activism-in-gaza-mapping-the-threat/ | title=Salafi-Jihadi Activism in Gaza | date=3 May 2010 }}</ref>
<ref>{{Cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/8203239.stm | title = Profile: Jund Ansar Allah |date=15 August 2009 | access-date = 28 February 2019 |language=en-GB}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web | url = https://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2009/08/hamas_and_al_qaeda_l.php | title = Hamas and al Qaeda-linked group clash in Gaza |date=14 August 2009 | website = www.longwarjournal.org | language=en-US | access-date = 28 February 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news | url = https://www.reuters.com/article/us-palestinians-hamas-warriors-sb-idUSTRE57E11A20090815 | title = FACTBOX: Five facts about Jund Ansar Allah | date = 15 August 2009 | work = Reuters | access-date = 28 February 2019 |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.longwarjournal.org/videos/2009/08/post.php |title=Al Qaeda-linked group declares Islamic state in Gaza – The Long War Journal |website=longwarjournal.org |access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite journal |last=Marshall |first=Warren |date=30 November 2010 |title=Al-Qaeda in Gaza: Isolating "the Base" |journal=Contemporary Voices: St Andrews Journal of International Relations |language=en |volume=1 |issue=1 |doi=10.15664/jtr.167 |doi-broken-date=1 November 2024 |issn=2516-3159 |doi-access=free |hdl=10023/5610 |hdl-access=free}}</ref>
<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.maannews.com/Content.aspx?ID=219339 |title=All 24 victims of Friday |agency=Ma'an News Agency |access-date=28 February 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news | url = https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/aug/15/hamas-battle-gaza-islamists-al-qaida | title = Hamas destroys al-Qaida group in violent Gaza battle | last = Beaumont | first = Peter | date = 15 August 2009 | work = The Observer | access-date = 28 February 2019 |language=en-GB |issn=0029-7712}}</ref>

sentences.text: ISIS arose in the rubble of the 2003 invasion of Iraq|2003 United States-led invasion of Iraq and the Syrian civil war (2011 in Syria|2011, List of ongoing armed conflicts|ongoing), then later spread to the Sinai Peninsula and elsewhere. Hamas government in the Gaza Strip|Hamas in Gaza clashed directly with the Sinai Province, but Hamas were also connected to List of armed factions in the Syrian Civil War|groups on multiple sides of the conflict with ISIS in Syria.

references.text: <ref name="BBC mon" >{{Cite web | title = BBC Monitoring – Essential Media Insight | url = https://monitoring.bbc.co.uk/product/c204uvs9 | access-date = 2024-10-13 | website = monitoring.bbc.co.uk BBC Monitoring }}</ref>

sentences.text: ISIS first discreetly issued threats to Hamas in 2015, in the same video message they also threatened Hamas' Fatah–Hamas conflict|two rivals Israel and Fatah.{{better source needed| reason = it would be good to add a well-known source in English or Arabic |date=October 2024}}

references.text: <ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.vox.com/2015/7/2/8886317/isis-hamas-gaza | title=ISIS is threatening Hamas in Gaza. That's scary news | date=2 July 2015 }}</ref>

<ref name="RÛDAW 2015">{{cite news | title = DAIŞê gef li Hemasê jî xwar | url=https://www.rudaw.net/kurmanci/world/010720152 | access-date = 13 October 2024 | work = Rudaw Media Network|RÛDAW (Latin Kurdish) | publisher = www.rudaw.net | date = 2015 | language = Latin Kurdish | location = Iraq | quote = Ew çekdarê DAIŞê dibêje, divê dewleta cihûyan (Îsraîl) û Hemas û Feth bizanin ku emê koka wan biqelînin û wan tine bikin. Sebeba wê yekê ku DAIŞ gefê li Hemasê dixwe, ew e ku qaşo Hemas nikare li Filistînê bi taybet li Xeze û kampa Yermûkê (kampa penaberên filistînî li Sûriyê) pîvanên îslamê bicîh bîne. Ev cara yekemîn e ku DAIŞê wiha Hemasê tehdîd dike. }}</ref>

sentences.text: In 2015 in Palestine|2015 Hamas began a propaganda campaign to combat Islamist anti-Hamas groups in the Gaza Strip|extremist ideologies in the Gaza Strip, At the time they denied it was targeted at ISIS or any other specific group. Mosques in the strip preached to promote a "centrist ideology".<ref name="Jpost 2015"/>

references.text: <ref name="Jpost 2015" >{{Cite web | date = 2015-04-12 | title = Hamas launches a campaign to combat 'extremist ideology,' says official | url = https://www.jpost.com/arab-israeli-conflict/hamas-launches-a-campaign-to-combat-extremist-ideology-says-official-396812 | access-date = 2024-10-13 | website = The Jerusalem Post |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: In 2017, Bombing of Rafah crossing by ISIS|an ISIS suicide bomber at Rafah Border Crossing killed a Hamas government in the Gaza Strip|Hamas government border guard (Nidal al-Jaafari, 28) and injured several others. Before anyone had claimed responsibility, Hamas described the bomber as an outlaw and ''“a person of deviant ideology”'', Hamas' terminology for Islamic extremists.

references.text: <ref name="toi suicide" >https://www.timesofisrael.com/hamas-guard-killed-in-suicide-bombing-at-gaza-border/</ref>

<ref name="AN 18 Aug 2017">{{cite news | title = Hamas guard killed in rare suicide attack in Gaza Strip | url = https://www.arabnews.com/node/1146196/middle-east | access-date = 9 October 2024 | work = Arab News | date = 18 August 2017 |language=en}}</ref>

<ref name="AN 18 Aug 2017"/> Other factions also condemned the bomber.<ref name="paltimes 17 August 2017" >{{cite news | title = Factions condemn Rafah bombing, describing it as "terrorist" | url = https://paltimes.ps/post/171660/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%81%D8%B5%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%84-%D8%AA%D8%AF%D9%8A%D9%86-%D8%AA%D9%81%D8%AC%D9%8A%D8%B1-%D8%B1%D9%81%D8%AD-%D9%88%D8%AA%D8%B5%D9%81%D9%87-%D8%A8%D9%80-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A5%D8%B1%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%A8%D9%8A |  access-date = 9 October 2024 | date = 17 August 2017 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20171025040046/https://paltimes.ps/post/171660/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%81%D8%B5%D8%A7%D8%A6%D9%84-%D8%AA%D8%AF%D9%8A%D9%86-%D8%AA%D9%81%D8%AC%D9%8A%D8%B1-%D8%B1%D9%81%D8%AD-%D9%88%D8%AA%D8%B5%D9%81%D9%87-%D8%A8%D9%80-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A5%D8%B1%D9%87%D8%A7%D8%A8%D9%8A | archive-date = 25 October 2017 | quote = Al-Qassam said in a brief statement at dawn on Thursday: “The martyr Al-Jaafari was one of the officers of the Border Guards Force and was martyred after one of the elements of the deviant ideology blew himself up in the security force on the Palestinian-Egyptian border”. }}</ref>

sentences.text: Hamas arrested dozens of Salafi movement|Salafi militants Islamist anti-Hamas groups in the Gaza Strip|in the Gaza Strip.

references.text: <ref name="toi war video" >{{cite web | title = Islamic State in Sinai declares war on Hamas in gruesome execution video | website = The Times of Israel | url = https://www.timesofisrael.com/islamic-state-in-sinai-declares-war-on-hamas-in-gruesome-execution-video/ | date = 4 January 2018 | access-date = 2024-10-09 | archive-url = https://archive.today/20241009080825/https://www.timesofisrael.com/islamic-state-in-sinai-declares-war-on-hamas-in-gruesome-execution-video/ | archive-date = 2024-10-09 }}</ref>

sentences.text: In early January 2018 in Palestine|2018, Palestinians from the Gaza Strip who had joined Wilayah Sinai|ISIS Sinai Province, captured and killed a man who they claimed was connected to the Qassam Brigades. The killers made a video of the murder and released it as a "declaration of war" against Hamas.<ref name="toi war video" /> The speaker in the video is referred to as Abu Kazem al-Maqdisi.<ref name="toi war video"/>

references.text: <ref name="AJ nae5z" >{{Cite news | date = 5 January 2018 | title = ISIS in Sinai executes a member and threatens Hamas | trans-title = تنظيم الدولة بسيناء يعدم عضوا ويهدد حماس | url = https://aja.me/nae5z | work = Al Jazeera Arabic }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news | date = 15 January 2018 | title = What Effect ISIS' Declaration Of War Against Hamas Could Have In The Middle East | url = https://www.npr.org/2018/01/15/578172703/what-effect-isis-declaration-of-war-against-hamas-could-have-in-the-middle-east | work = NPR }}</ref>

sentences.text: ''Military.com'' reported that on 3 November 2017, that a U.S. drone conducted two airstrikes against Islamic State in Somalia, at least six missiles were used which struck in Buqa, 37 miles north of Qandala, AFRICOM said in a statement that "several terrorists" were killed and that the strikes were carried out in coordination with Somalia's government; the strikes marked first time that the US has conducted airstrikes against ISS terrorists in Somalia. CNN reported that US drone aircraft conducted 5 strikes against Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab and ISS-linked militants between 9 and 12 November, killing 36 al-Shabaab and 4 ISIS terrorists. The United States|US now estimates there are between 3,000 and 6,000 al-Shabaab fighters and less than 250 ISS operatives in Somalia. The US conducted a three strikes in al Bayda Governorate targeting ISIL in Yemen between 10 and 12 November 2017, killing 5 suspected militants.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=https://www.military.com/daily-news/2017/11/04/us-carries-out-1st-airstrikes-against-isis-in-somalia.html|title=US Carries Out 1st Airstrikes Against ISIS in Somalia|publisher=Military.com|date=4 November 2017}}</ref>

<ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/21/politics/somalia-us-airstrike-al-shabaab/index.html|title=US airstrike in Somalia kills more than 100 al-Shabaab militants|publisher=CNN|date=21 November 2017}}</ref>

<ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/13/politics/us-strikes-yemen-somalia/index.html|title=US military launches series of strikes in Yemen and Somalia|publisher=CNN|date=13 November 2017}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 22 January 2015, U.S. Ambassador to Iraq Stuart Jones stated that the coalition airstrikes had degraded ISIL, including killing off half of their leaders in Iraq and Syria.

references.text: <ref name="US airstrikes killed over 6,000 ISIL fighters">{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://english.alarabiya.net/en/News/middle-east/2015/01/22/Air-strikes-killed-6-000-ISIS-fighters-U-S-ambassador.html|title=Air strikes killed 6,000 ISIS fighters: U.S. ambassador|date=22 January 2015|publisher=Al Arabiya}}</ref>

sentences.text: In early February 2015, the Australian Defence Minister, Kevin Andrews (politician)|Kevin Andrews, stated that more than 6,000 ISIL fighters had been killed in coalition airstrikes since they began, and that over {{convert|800|km2|mi2}} had been recaptured; yet ISIL strength was estimated to have grown during this period to around 31,500 core fighters, including 3,000 fighters from Western nations.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite news||last=Smethurst|first=Annika|author-link=Annika Smethurst|date=3 February 2015|title=Australian forces claw back Iraq territory from Islamic State (IS)|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/australian-forces-claw-back-iraq-terroritory-from-islamic-state-is/story-fni0fiyv-1227205679244?nk=c0d8f5143b17bff43b0849142275a98e|newspaper=Herald Sun|location=Melbourne|publisher=News Corp Australia|access-date=6 February 2015}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 23 February 2015, U.S. General Lloyd Austin stated that over 8,500 ISIL militants had been killed by Coalition airstrikes in Iraq and Syria. In early March 2015, General Lloyd repeated this statement, saying that "ISIS has assumed a defensive crouch" in Iraq, and that "We are where we said we would be," in relation to the airstrikes. This was in contrast to Jordan's claim that its airstrikes alone had killed 7,000 ISIL militants in Iraq and Syria over the course of 3 days, from 5 to 7 February 2015.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://www.worldbulletin.net/middle-east/155536/airstrikes-kill-8500-isil-fighters-says-us-general|title=Airstrikes 'kill 8,500' ISIL fighters says U.S. general|date=23 February 2015|work=World Bulletin}}</ref>

<ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://www.military.com/daily-news/2015/03/03/us-commander-says-coalition-has-killed-8500-isis-fighters.html|title=US Commander Says Coalition Has Killed 8,500 ISIS Fighters|work=Military.com|date=3 March 2015|access-date=14 May 2015}}</ref>

<ref name="ISIL mauled by Jordanian airstrikes" /><ref name="Jordan">{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/jordanian-airstrikes-kill-7000-isis-fighters-iraq-syria-1487178|title=Jordanian air strikes 'kill 7,000 Isis fighters' in Iraq and Syria|work=International Business Times UK|access-date=14 May 2015|date=9 February 2015}}</ref>

sentences.text: In June 2015, U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Antony Blinken stated that over 10,000 ISIL fighters had been killed by Coalition airstrikes against the Islamic State.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite news||title=U.S. official: Airstrikes killed 10,000 Islamic State fighters |url=https://eu.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2015/06/03/islamic-state-death-toll/28415743/ |work=USA Today |date=June 3, 2015}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 21 January 2016, France's defence minister Jean-Yves Le Drian stated that over 22,000 ISIL fighters had been killed by Coalition airstrikes in Iraq and Syria.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://www.france24.com/en/20160121-anti-coalition-has-killed-22000-jihadists-mid-2014-france |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160131014305/http://www.france24.com/en/20160121-anti-coalition-has-killed-22000-jihadists-mid-2014-france |url-status=dead |archive-date=31 January 2016|title=Anti-IS coalition has killed 22,000 jihadists since mid-2014: France|publisher=France 24|date=21 January 2016}}</ref>

sentences.text: In August 2016, U.S. Army Lieutenant General Sean MacFarland told reporters at a news briefing "Although it's no measure of success and its difficult to confirm, we estimate that over the past 11 months we've killed about 25,000 enemy fighters. When you add that to the 20,000 estimated killed prior to our arrival, that's 45,000 enemies taken off the battlefield."

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/08/10/nearly-45000-isis-linked-fighters-killed-in-past-2-years-us-military-official-says.html|title=Nearly 45,000 ISIS-linked fighters killed in past 2 years, US military official says|publisher=Fox News|date=10 August 2016}}</ref>

sentences.text: In December 2016, a senior US military official told CNN that as many as 50,000 ISIL fighters have been killed since the war against the terror group began.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=http://edition.cnn.com/2016/12/09/politics/isis-dead-us-military/|title=Military: 50,000 ISIS fighters killed|publisher=CNN|date=9 December 2016}}</ref>

sentences.text: In 2023, the US Central Command issued a statement announcing that it had killed IS leader Khalid Aydd Ahmed al-Jabouri. According to the statement, al-Jabouri had been involved in planning attacks in the Middle East and Europe. The statement also claimed that no civilians were killed in the strike.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite web||url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-65172448|title=Khalid Aydd Ahmed al-Jabouri: US says it kills senior IS commander in Syria|publisher=BBC News|date=4 April 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: According to ''Airwars'', a team of independent journalists, by August 2015, 450 civilians had been killed by the U.S.-led coalition air campaign against ISIL in Iraq and Syria (of whom roughly 60% in Syria, 40% in Iraq). By that time, the United States|U.S.-led coalition officially acknowledged only two non-combatant deaths. According to ''Airwars'', by January 2016, "between 815 and 1,149 civilian non-combatants appear likely to have been killed in 135 incidents where there is fair reporting publicly available of an event, and where Coalition strikes were confirmed in the near vicinity on that date."

references.text: <ref name=guar3-8-15>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/aug/03/us-led-air-strikes-on-isis-targets-killed-more-than-450-civilians-report Hundreds of civilians killed in US-led air strikes on Isis targets – report]. ''The Guardian'', 3 August 2015. Retrieved 19 August 2015.</ref>

<ref>"[https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/checkpoint/wp/2016/01/15/for-third-time-in-war-against-the-islamic-state-pentagon-admits-to-killing-civilians/ For third time in war against the Islamic State, Pentagon admits to killing civilians]". ''The Washington Post''. 15 January 2016.</ref>

sentences.text: According to ''Airwars'', about 1000 civilians had been killed by the United States|U.S.-led coalition air campaign in March 2017 alone, gathering controversy and concern relating to the presidency of Donald Trump.

references.text: <ref>"[https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/checkpoint/wp/2017/03/25/u-s-military-acknowledges-strike-on-mosul-site-where-over-100-were-allegedly-killed/?tid=pm_world_pop U.S. military acknowledges strike on Mosul site where more than 100 were allegedly killed]". ''The Washington Post''. 25 March 2017.</ref>

sentences.text: According to ''Airwars'', the air strikes and artillery of United States|U.S.-led coalition killed as many as 6,000 civilians in Iraq and Syria in 2017. According to ''Airwars'', "In 2017 the war against ISIS [Islamic State] moved into the most densely-populated urban centres controlled by the group, with dire results for civilians."<ref name="sms" />

references.text: <ref>"[https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/civilian-deaths-tripled-in-us-led-campaign-during-2017-watchdog-alleges/2018/01/18/ccfae298-fc6d-11e7-a46b-a3614530bd87_story.html Civilian deaths tripled in U.S.-led campaign against ISIS in 2017, watchdog alleges]". ''The Washington Post''. 18 January 2018.</ref>

<ref name="sms">"[https://www.smh.com.au/world/usled-coalition-killed-up-to-6000-civilians-in-fight-against-is-watchdog-says-20180119-h0kpx3.html US-led coalition killed up to 6000 civilians in fight against IS: watchdog says]". ''The Sydney Morning Herald''. 18 January 2018.</ref>

sentences.text: Amnesty International and monitoring group Airwars report said, more than 1,600 civilians were killed in United States|US-led coalition include, United States, United Kingdom|Britain and France, during the four-month airstrike campaign against ISIL group from the Syrian city of Raqqa in 2017. The Coalition states have conducted 34,464 strikes against ISIL targets between August 2014 and end of March 2019, and killed at least 1,291 civilians.

references.text: <ref>{{#invoke:cite news||title=US-led coalition 'killed 1,600 civilians' in Syria's Raqqa|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/04/led-coalition-killed-1600-civilians-syria-raqqa-190425135739616.html|access-date=27 April 2019|publisher=Al Jazeera English|Al Jazeera|date=25 April 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{#invoke:cite news||last1=Martinez|first1=Luis|title=Coalition strikes killed 1,600 civilians in Raqqa says new report|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/coalition-strikes-killed-1600-civilians-raqqa-report/story?id=62629765|access-date=27 April 2019|publisher=ABC News (United States)|ABC News|date=25 April 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{#invoke:cite news||last1=Hansler|first1=Jennifer|last2=Browne|first2=Ryan|title=Report: US-led coalition killed 1,600 civilians in Raqqa in 2017|url=https://edition.cnn.com/2019/04/25/politics/amnesty-international-report-raqqa/index.html|access-date=27 April 2019|publisher=CNN|date=25 April 2019}}</ref>

<ref>{{#invoke:cite news||title=IS conflict: Coalition strikes on Raqqa 'killed 1,600 civilians'|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-48044115|access-date=27 April 2019|publisher=BBC News|date=25 April 2019}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 1 February 2015, Iraq's Foreign Minister Ibrahim al-Jaafari stated that the War on ISIL was effectively "World War III", due to ISIL's proclamation of a worldwide caliphate, its aims to conquer the world, and its success in spreading the conflict to multiple countries outside of the Levant region. Speaking of ISIL's destruction of pre-Islamic sites in the region, Syria's head of antiquities, Maamoun Abdul Karim, stated that "this is the entire world's battle". In June 2015, U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Antony Blinken said that ISIL "stands for nothing and depends on people who will fall for anything."

references.text: <ref name="Iraq's Prime Minister equates the War on ISIL to World War III">[https://www.reuters.com/video/2015/02/01/fight-against-islamic-state-is-world-war?videoId=363066236 ‘Fight against Islamic State is World War 3 – Iraqi foreign minister’]. Reuters (video), 1 February 2015. Retrieved 17 February 2015.</ref>
<ref>{{#invoke:cite news||url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-32820857|title=Islamic State seizes Syria's ancient Palmyra|work=BBC News|access-date=5 December 2015}}</ref>

<ref>{{#invoke:cite news||title=US: Coalition has killed 10,000 ISIL fighters |url=http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/6/3/us-coalition-has-killed-10000-isil-fighters.html |work=Al Jazeera English|Al Jazeera |date=June 3, 2015}}</ref>
